imgDesc.text:
<color=#ffe14b>Birch</color>
A tall tree that originates in the far north but which has since spread all over Teyvat. It produces a great many branches and is a key wood resource throughout the various nations. Birches are a common sight in the <color=#ffe14b>Windwail Highland</color> and other places.
Cut a Birch down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Birch Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Cuihua Tree</color>
A tree from which fruit hangs heavy. They say that some lush trees had fruits and cores which both had the color of sunset, hence earning them the moniker of "Cuihua Tree"
Cuihua Trees are oft found around the <color=#ffe14b>Starfell Valley</color> and <color=#ffe14b>Bishui Plain</color> .
Cut a Cuihua Tree down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Cuihua Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Pine</color>
A majestic tree with needle-like leaves which can live for up to a thousand years. Their sturdy forms can be found all over the continent, their winter-withstanding bones still standing strong in warmer lands. This has earned them the nickname of "winter pines."
These trees are endemic to the <color=#ffe14b>Dragonspine</color> region and other areas.
Cut Pine down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Pine Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Sandbearer Tree</color>
A tree with especially thick branches. This tree is exceedingly hardy, for its roots reach deep and it fears neither dry seasons nor evil weather. It is said that such trees can survive in the desert and even beat back the effects of salinization and drought, which is why it is honored as the Sandbearer Tree.
Such trees are commonly found in the area around <color=#ffe14b>Minlin</color> , <color=#ffe14b>Lisha</color> , and other locations.
Cut a Sandbearer Tree down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Sandbearer Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Qingce Bamboo</color>
An emerald bamboo from Mt. Qingce that stands proudly, straight as any sword. It is often used as a symbol for a pure, righteous, all-enduring gentleman.
One may find many a Qingce Bamboo in the vicinity of <color=#ffe14b>Bishui Plain</color> and other places.
Cut Qingce Bamboo down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Bamboo Segments</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Cedar</color>
A tall, lush and dignified tree that is evergreen throughout the seasons. Even the chilling wind and snow cannot mar its emerald greenery.
Cedars are common in the area around <color=#ffe14b>Starfell Valley</color> and elsewhere.
Cut a Cedar down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Fragrant Cedar Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Faber's Fir</color>
A tree that can be commonly found. Once it has adapted to its surroundings, it will grow swiftly into worthy timber.
Faber's Firs can often be found in the area around <color=#ffe14b>Galesong Hill</color> , <color=#ffe14b>Starfell Valley</color> , and others.
Cut a Faber's Fir down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Fir Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Sakura Tree</color>
An elegant tree that is pleasing to the eye, sporadically found across the eastern side of the nation. When the tree blossoms, it takes the appearance of a drifting pink cloud, and is often regarded as one of the most beautiful features of Inazuma.
Sakura Trees can be found dotting the landscape of <color=#ffe14b>Narukami Island</color> and other places. Cut a Sakura Tree down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Yumemiru Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Amur Maple</color>
A slender tree that sways with fan-shaped leaves red as fire. Its vibrant color paints the mountainside in red and is often quoted in poem and song as the symbol of late autumn.
Amur Maples can be found dotting the landscape of <color=#ffe14b>Narukami Island</color> and other places. Cut an Amur Maple down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Maple Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Inazuman Cedar</color>
A straight and sturdy tree with uniquely-shaped leaves and form that make it easy to identify.
Inazuman Cedars can be found across <color=#ffe14b>Narukami Island</color> and in other places. Cut an Inazuman Cedar down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Aralia Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Otogi Tree</color>
A plain and ordinary-looking tree found throughout Inazuma. Some nursery rhymes portray the tree as the "whisper of nature," which has coined its name, "Otogi Tree," meaning the tree that keeps one company.
Otogi Trees can be found all across <color=#ffe14b>Inazuma</color> . Cut an Otogi Tree down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Otogi Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Brightwood Tree</color>
Uniquely-shaped plants that are very long-lived indeed. Its structure is quite unlike that of other arbors, presenting a rather free-spirited and changeable appearance. It is also hardy indeed, which allows it to survive in both the rainforest and the desert.
Cut Brightwood Trees down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Brightwood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Karmaphala Tree</color>
A tree with a most unique look that loves high-temperature environments. Its wood is of the highest quality. It is said that its habitat can cause it to produce different-colored canopies.
Cut Karmaphala Trees down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Karmaphala Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Adhigama Tree</color>
This tree can be commonly found in Sumeru. Most of them are spread throughout the nation's eastern rainforest, and has spent much time in companionship with its researchers and Forest Rangers. As such, it has witnessed many moments of dawning "comprehension."
Cut Adhigama Trees down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Adhigama Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Mountain Date Tree</color>
This tree has a vivid, unique look. Its stem is wide and thick, and its bark is exceedingly hardy, allowing it to survive in the searing desert.
Cut Mountain Date Trees down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Mountain Date Wood</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>Athel Tree</color>
A tree that can be found in hostile environments. It has vibrant and uniquely-shaped leaves and its root system is quite vast. These trees can, when necessary, enter a state in which they use the minimum amount of energy, which is a survival method unique to it.
Cut Athel Trees down to obtain <color=#ffe14b>Athel Wood</color> .
